intro: Psychotria sixaolensis, commonly known as the Brazilian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria sixaolensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
